alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:13AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Nashua affecting Valley County. .Snowmelt and recent precipitation has led to minor flooding. Ice jams are being reported in the area and may lead to rapid changes in river levels. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Glasgow, Nashua... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Nashua. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, lowland flooding will begin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Saturday was 27.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.0 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then rise to 28.1 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.6 feet on 04/18/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1115 AM MDT.
